q: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
h:
“A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
h:
“Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Ability is a poor man's wealth.
h:
“Ability is a poor man's wealth.” —
John Wooden

q: Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.
h:
“Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.
h:
“Life is like a beautiful melody, only the lyrics are messed up.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: When you make a choice, you change the future.
h:
“When you make a choice, you change the future.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
h:
“Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:
“A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Don´t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.
h:
“Don´t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.
h:
“How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
h:
“Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.” —
Mark Twain

q: Peace begins with a smile.
h:
“Peace begins with a smile.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Make your life a mission - not an intermission.
h:
“Make your life a mission - not an intermission.” —
Unknown

q: Those who realize their folly are not true fools.
h:
“Those who realize their folly are not true fools.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
h:
“Words are clothes that thoughts wear” —
Samuel Butler

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.
h:
“Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: Do one thing every day that scares you.
h:
“Do one thing every day that scares you.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.
h:
“Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.” —
Isaac Newton

q: Fools resist. The wise embrace.
h:
“Fools resist. The wise embrace.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
h:
“Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.
h:
“Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.” —
John Lennon

q: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.
h:
“Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always comes around to where you started again.” —
Stephen King

q: Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.
h:
“Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.
h:
“Be happy in the moment, that's enough. Each moment is all we need, not more.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
h:
“Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.
h:
“Don't give up on your dreams, or your dreams will give up on you.” —
John Wooden

q: He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.
h:
“He who possesses most must be most afraid of loss.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: If you realize that you're the problem, then you can change yourself, learn something and grow wiser. Don't blame other people for your problems.
h:
“If you realize that you're the problem, then you can change yourself, learn something and grow wiser. Don't blame other people for your problems.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
h:
“Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.” —
Plato

q: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
h:
“As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Life is not just the passing of time. Life is the collection of experiences and their intensity.
h:
“Life is not just the passing of time. Life is the collection of experiences and their intensity.” —
Jim Rohn

q: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
h:
“If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
h:
“The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.” —
Aristotle

q: Logic is like the sword - those who appeal to it shall perish by it.
h:
“Logic is like the sword - those who appeal to it shall perish by it.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
h:
“Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it. ” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Change yourself and you have done your part in changing the world.
h:
“Change yourself and you have done your part in changing the world.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Either get busy living or get busy dying.
h:
“Either get busy living or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: No man is free who is not master of himself.
h:
“No man is free who is not master of himself.” —
Epictetus

q: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
h:
“Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: You change the world by being yourself.
h:
“You change the world by being yourself.” —
Yoko Ono

q: Youth has no age.
h:
“Youth has no age.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: To acquire true self power you have to feel beneath no one, be immune to criticism and be fearless.
h:
“To acquire true self power you have to feel beneath no one, be immune to criticism and be fearless.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: I have no methods; all I do is accept people as they are.
h:
“I have no methods; all I do is accept people as they are.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.
h:
“Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.
h:
“Formal education will make you a living, self-education will make you a fortune.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.
Always give without remembering and always receive without forgetting.
Be a light unto yourself; betake yourselves to no external refuge. Hold fast to the Truth. Look not for refuge to anyone besides yourselves.
Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
h:
“Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.
h:
“The more people you help become successful the more successful you become.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Rest in reason; move in passion.
h:
“Rest in reason; move in passion.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: If you want more luck, take more chances.
h:
“If you want more luck, take more chances.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
h:
“Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.
h:
“Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.” —
Celestine Chua

q: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
h:
“We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
h:
“The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Every great change is preceded by chaos.
h:
“Every great change is preceded by chaos.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Don't want anything. Then you get everything.
h:
“Don't want anything. Then you get everything.” —
Seungsahn

q: Freedom lies in being bold.
h:
“Freedom lies in being bold.” —
Robert Frost

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Happiness is only real, when shared.
h:
“Happiness is only real, when shared.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.
h:
“Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
h:
“Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.” —
Steve Jobs

q: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
h:
“The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.” —
Rumi

q: Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.
h:
“Hardly anybody recognizes the most significant moments of their life at the time they happen.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
h:
“Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.” —
A.A. Milne

q: My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.
h:
“My powers are ordinary. Only my application brings me success.” —
Isaac Newton

q: What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.
h:
“What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
h:
“Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement. ” —
W. Clement Stone

q: Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.
h:
“Admire as much as you can. Most people do not admire enough.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Help others for all the times that you have been ignored. Be kind to others, for all the times that you have been scorned.
h:
“Help others for all the times that you have been ignored. Be kind to others, for all the times that you have been scorned.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Life moves on and so should we.
h:
“Life moves on and so should we.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Love the life you live, live the life you love.
h:
“Love the life you live, live the life you love.” —
Bob Marley

q: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
h:
“If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Common sense is not so common.
h:
“Common sense is not so common. ” —
Voltaire

q: Do something worth remembering.
h:
“Do something worth remembering.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive.
h:
“Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive.” —
Criss Jami

q: The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.
h:
“The health of nations is more important than the wealth of nations.” —
Will Rogers

q: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
h:
“It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
h:
“Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.
h:
“The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: Loss is nothing else but change and change is nature's delight.
h:
“Loss is nothing else but change and change is nature's delight.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.
h:
“Surrender to what is. Let go of what was. Have faith in what will be.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.
h:
“The biggest mistake we could ever make in our lives is to think we work for anybody but ourselves.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.
h:
“Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.” —
Dogen

q: Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.
h:
“Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Wherever you are is the entry point.
h:
“Wherever you are is the entry point.” —
Kabir

q: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.
h:
“If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people.
h:
“Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: FOCUS - Follow One Course Until Successful
h:
“FOCUS - Follow One Course Until Successful” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
h:
“A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him. ” —
David Brinkley

q: Create with the heart; build with the mind.
h:
“Create with the heart; build with the mind.” —
Criss Jami

q: Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.
h:
“Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
h:
“We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.” —
Emily Dickinson
